htw.vs1.filesystem.FileSystem.virtual

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • htw.vs1.filesystem.FileSystem.virtual.FileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystemInterface

    public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileSystemInterface
    The FileSystem represents a file system on which you can perform actions like:
    • print the current Working directory: printWorkingDirectory()
    • change the working directory changeDirectory(String)
    • list the content of the current folder listDirectoryContent()
    • rename(String, String) / delete(String)
    Created by felix on 03.06.15.

        public void changeDirectory(@NotNull
                            java.lang.String path)
                     throws FileSystemException

        Changes the current working directory to the Folder under the given path.

        Specified by:
        changeDirectory in interface FileSystemInterface
        Parameters:
        path - path to the Folder. This can be either a relative path, an absolute path or simple the name of a Folder in the current working directory.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if the object identified by the given name is not available.
